utils.graphs¶

utils.graphs.apply_style(style_name: str = 'dark') → None[source]¶

Apply consistent styling to matplotlib plots.

utils.graphs.create_box_data(expected: float, lower: float, upper: float) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Create standardized box plot data structure for matplotlib.

utils.graphs.create_legend(ax: Axes, handles: List, title: str = 'Legend', style_name: str = 'dark') → None[source]¶

Create a legend with consistent styling and positioning.

utils.graphs.display_inference_bounds(confidence_bounds: List[List[Tuple[float, float, float]]], labels: List[str], title: str, predictor_names: List[str] | None = None, property_name: str = 'Density', save_path: str | None = None) → None[source]¶

Display inference confidence bounds as grouped box plots.

utils.graphs.display_inference_points(group_data: List[List[float]], labels: List[str], title: str, property_name: str = 'Density', save_path: str | None = None) → None[source]¶

Display inference points as scatter plots with background ranges.

utils.graphs.display_model_bounds(expected: List[float], lower: List[float], upper: List[float], labels: List[str], title: str, metric_name: str, save_path: str | None = None, nice: bool = True, model_types: List[str] | None = None) → None[source]¶

Display model performance bounds as bar charts or box plots.

utils.graphs.display_model_rmse(expected: List[float], labels: List[str], title: str) → None[source]¶

Display RMSE values as bar chart with value labels.

utils.graphs.display_test_bias_for_group(biases: List[float], alpha: float, name_list: List[str], group_label: str) → None[source]¶

Display test bias statistics as bar chart with threshold line.

utils.graphs.format_axes(ax: Axes, labels: List[str], title: str, ylabel: str, style_name: str = 'dark', rotation: float = 12.0) → None[source]¶

Format axes with consistent styling including ticks, labels, and title.

utils.graphs.get_model_colors(model_types: List[str] | None = None) → List[str][source]¶

Get color mapping for different model types.

utils.graphs.plot_single_variable_fitness(estimated: List[float], real_property: List[float], estimated_name: str = 'Estimated Value', real_name: str = 'Real Value', display_stats: bool = False) → None[source]¶

Plot correlation between estimated and real values with trend line.

utils.graphs.save_plot(title: str, save_path: str | None = None) → None[source]¶

Save plot with consistent naming and high-quality settings.

Create a figure with consistent styling and contour formatting.
